710654f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 35th Street (West)
710654f-a.text:
424 to 428 Eleventh Ave., east side, north of West 35th Street, show-
ing a 5-story structure, No. 426, gutted by a fire that cost 25 lives.
Date of this occurrence was October 1st. Today (1937), Macys factory
stands on this site.
October 1, 1903.
Gift of Dr. Gustave Scholer.

710656f.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 35th Street (West)
710656f.text:
426 Eleventh Ave., east side, north from West 35th Street, showing
the rear of a 5-story tenement after a conflagration that cost 25 lives.
Today (1937), upon this site stands Macys factory, a 12-story structure, at
the N.E. corner of 35th Street.
October 1, 1903.
Views 1 & 2.
ift of Gustaw Scholer.

710643f.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 35th Street (West)
710643f.text:
Eleventh Avenue, (left), at the N. E. corner of,W.
3Sth Street (right), showing R. '. Macy and Company's
newly erected 12 story factory, which replaced the old houses
No's 418-42o Eleventh Avenue.
About 1922
qqift of E. M. Jenks
Payser & Patzig

712273f-a.title: Manhattan: 35th Street - 11th Avenue
712273f-a.text:
Milk sheds in the West Shore Railroad's yards, 35th Street, north
side, from Twelfth to Eleventh Avenues.
March 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

710645f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 35th Street (West)
710645f-a.text:
Eleventh Ave., at and adjoining the S.E. corner of West 35th Street.
Also shown is West 35th Street, at the S.E. corner of Eleventh Ave. View
is taken frow and shows a portion of the West Shore Railway yards.
July 9, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

710650f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 35th Street (West)
710650f-a.text:
11th Avenue, west side, from W. 35th to 36th Streets, sh
Libbv warehouse and railroad sidings under demolition. View
interior shot, the photographer viewing northeastward towards
Street and the Avenue. On the right is the R. H. Macy and Co
house, located at the N. E. corner of 11th Avenue and W. 35th
February 5, 1932
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr

710655f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 35th Street (West)
710655f-a.text:
Eleventh Ave., west side, north from West 35th, to and including
37th Streets. Also shown is West 36th Street, at, adjoining and west
of the N.M. corner of Eleventh Ave.
March 20, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

710640f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 35th Street (West)
710640f-a.text:
Eleventh Ave., south from Wiest 35th Street, showing work
progresSing on the track removal project of the New York Central
Railroad at this point. Note the steel bridgelike structure on the
easterly side of the thoroughfare that will raise this Avenue ten
feet above its former level and permit the railroad tracks to pass
underneath.connecting the trackage in the rock cut with the yard
layout on the westerly side of the Avenue. Appearing on the left,
at the N.E. corner of the Avenue and West 35th Street is the old
R.H. Macy Warehouse undergoing structural renovation to further this
work and permit freight handling facilities to its future tenants
under Railroad ownership.
1937.
qift of New York Central System
Ruublicity Bureau.

710640f-b.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 35th Street (West)
710640f-b.text:
Eleventh Ave., south from Wiest 35th Street, showing work
progresSing on the track removal project of the New York Central
Railroad at this point. Note the steel bridgelike structure on the
easterly side of the thoroughfare that will raise this Avenue ten
feet above its former level and permit the railroad tracks to pass
underneath.connecting the trackage in the rock cut with the yard
layout on the westerly side of the Avenue. Appearing on the left,
at the N.E. corner of the Avenue and West 35th Street is the old
R.H. Macy Warehouse undergoing structural renovation to further this
work and permit freight handling facilities to its future tenants
under Railroad ownership.
1937.
qift of New York Central System
Ruublicity Bureau.

710646f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 35th Street (West)
710646f-a.text:
EEleventh Ave. (foreground), at the N.E. corner of West 35th
Street (rigdt), showing the front of the old R.H. Macy warehouse being
supported by a new foundation to permit the New York Central Rai lroad
tracks to pass beneath. The street levels on both sides are being
elevated about 10 feet so that the former second story is now the first.
1937.
Gift of New York Central System
Publicity Bureau.

710647f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 35th Street (West)
710647f-a.text:
Eleventh Ave. (right), at the N.E. corner of West 35th Street
(left), showing a rear view of the Macy warehouse ai this location.
This structure stands on a new steel and concrete foundation between
which the main tracks of the New York Central Railroad will pass to
connect with the loop and yard tracks beyond. Note also the new
raised street and avenue levels, same being elevated about 10 feet.
The photographer is viewing in a southwestward direction from 36th
Street, eastward of Eleventh Ave.
1937.
Cift of New York Central Railway System
Publicity Bureau.

710648f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 35th Street (West)
710648f-a.text:
Eleventh Ave. (right), at the N.E. corner of West 35th Street
(left), showing a rear view of the Macy warehouse at this location.
A new foundation is being installed under this structure to permit
the New York Central Railroad tracks to pass under it at various angles
and elevations and to equip it with an outside elevator and a 5 car
sidetrack and freight platform. The streets in front and alongside
were elevated ten feet, so that the former second floor was promoted to
the first.
July 24, 1937.
Gift of New Yorl Central System
Publicity Bureau.
